ch.aplu.robotsim

Class ColorSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Actor
      • ch.aplu.robotsim.Part
        • ch.aplu.robotsim.ColorSensor

  • public class ColorSensor
extends Part
    Class that represents a color sensor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int[][] colorCubes
      Color cubes for detecting color labels. 6 user adaptable int arrays with red_min, red_max, green_min, green_max, blue_min, blue_max for the colors Black, Blue, Green, Yellow, Red, White.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ColorSensor()
      Creates a sensor instance connected to port S1.
      ColorSensor(SensorPort port)
      Creates a sensor instance connected to the given port.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns the color detected by the color sensor at the current location.

      Returns a integer number ID for the current color reading.

      Returns one of the enums of ColorLabel.
      java.lang.String getColorStr()
      Returns the name of the enums of ColorLabel.
      int getLightValue()
      Returns the brightness (scaled intensity in the HSB color model) detected by the light sensor at the current location.
      SensorPort getPort()
      Returns the port of the sensor.
      static boolean inColorCube(java.awt.Color color, int[] colorCube)
      Checks if given color lies within given color cube.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • colorCubes

        public static int[][] colorCubes
        Color cubes for detecting color labels. 6 user adaptable int arrays with red_min, red_max, green_min, green_max, blue_min, blue_max for the colors Black, Blue, Green, Yellow, Red, White.
        Example: Redefine blue cube:
        ColorSensor.colorCubes[1] = new int[]{0, 2, 0, 2, 0, 2};

    • Constructor Detail

      • ColorSensor

        public ColorSensor(SensorPort port)
        Creates a sensor instance connected to the given port. The port selection determines the position of the sensor: S1: right; S2: left, S3: middle, S4: rear-middle.
        Parameters:
        port - the port where the sensor is plugged-in

      • ColorSensor

        public ColorSensor()
        Creates a sensor instance connected to port S1.

    • Method Detail

      • getLightValue

        public int getLightValue()
        Returns the brightness (scaled intensity in the HSB color model) detected by the light sensor at the current location. Calls Thread.sleep(1) to prevent CPU overload in close polling loops.
        Returns:
        the brightness of the background color at the current location (0..1000, 0: dark, 1000: bright).

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Returns the color detected by the color sensor at the current location. Calls Thread.sleep(1) to prevent CPU overload in close polling loops.
        Returns:
        the background color at the current location

      • getColorID

        public int getColorID()
        Returns a integer number ID for the current color reading. The colors are checked to be inside the public static colorCubes array. This array may be adapted to your illumination and color environment.
        ID 0: Undefined
        ID 1: Black
        ID 2: Blue
        ID 3: Green
        ID 4: Yellow
        ID 5: Red
        ID 6: White
        Returns:
        a integer code for the currently detected color (0..6)

      • getColorLabel

        public ColorLabel getColorLabel()
        Returns one of the enums of ColorLabel.
        UNDEFINED
        BLACK
        BLUE
        GREEN
        YELLOW
        RED
        WHITE
        The colors are checked to be inside the public static colorCubes array. This array may be adapted to your illumination and color environment.
        Returns:
        an ColorLabel enum value for the currently detected color.

      • getColorStr

        public java.lang.String getColorStr()
        Returns the name of the enums of ColorLabel.
        UNDEFINED
        BLACK
        BLUE
        GREEN
        YELLOW
        RED
        WHITE
        The colors are checked to be inside the public static colorCubes array. This array may be adapted to your illumination and color environment.
        Returns:
        an ColorLabel enum name for the currently detected color.

      • inColorCube

        public static boolean inColorCube(java.awt.Color color,
                  int[] colorCube)
        Checks if given color lies within given color cube.
        Parameters:
        color - the color to check
        colorCube - an integer array of 6 boundary values in the order: red_min, red_max, green_min, green_max, blue_min, blue_max
        Returns:
        true, if the color is within the color cube; otherwise false

      • getPort

        public SensorPort getPort()
        Returns the port of the sensor.
        Returns:
        the sensor port
